results.title: Mobility
results.creator_credit: Roger Hart, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Examines the complex range of problems involved in Third World urban transport, from cost and available technology to the different needs of the industrialized middle class and the urban poor, and proposes some surprising solutions. This film explores how transportation planners and city governments try to solve the problems associated with the growth of cities, especially the increased pressure on existing transportation systems.

results.title: Mixed blood
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Steven Fierberg, Antoine Gannage and Sara Films
results.brief_description: Morrissey’s post-Warhol feature film about gang violence in New York’s Alphabet City. Marilia Pera is outstanding as the Brazilian leader of the Mercentanos gang. She is a drug-dealer and pimp, but also mother to a group of teenage boys who obey her every command, be it shooting a rival or doing the laundry. “Mixed Blood” is violent and disturbing but it maintains a comic tone throughout that refuses sentimentality and cliche. This is a drug “exploitation” movie scored to a festive, breezy Latin beat.

results.title: Mitosis: how cells divide and multiply
results.creator_credit: D.G. Perrin, A.S. Fraser and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Uses simple animation to show the essential changes in the nucleus leading up to its division into two daughter cells. Explains why each daughter cell contains the same number of chromosomes as the parent cell.
results.description: Uses simple animation to show the essential changes in the nucleus leading up to its division into two daughter cells. Explains why each daughter cell contains the same number of chromosomes as the parent cell.

results.title: Mister Whiskers: my favourite nursery rhymes
results.creator_credit: Lindesay Dresden, Elizabeth Antheunis, Franciscus Henri and Franciscus Henri Productions
results.brief_description: Join Mr Whiskers and his dog Smiggy in their garden for 48 of your favourite nursery rhymes. Including the following classics: Rock a bye baby; Here we go round the mulberry bush; Baa Baa black sheep; Hickory dickory dock; Hey diddle diddle; Three blind mice; Rub a dub dub; Miss Polly had a dolly; and, Three blind mice. Includes two bonus songs: Mister Whiskers monkey business and Clapping Land from the animated, ‘Hello Mister Whiskers’.

results.title: Mister Roberts
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, John Ford, Leland Hayward and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hailed by critics as a classic of the American cinema, “Mister Roberts” is an adaptation of the smash hit Broadway play about life on a small naval cargo ship floating ‘somewhere between the Islands of Tedium and Ennui’ in the Pacific Ocean during World War II. Fonda is outstanding as the gentle cargo officer who protects his men from the shop’s tyrannical captain, played by James Cagney. Also in the cast is Jack Lemmon in his Academy Award winning role as Ensign Pulver and William Powell as Doc Daneeka.

results.title: Masters of Animation 1
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Education Film Centre
results.brief_description: A survey, recent and past, from Great Britain, Yugoslavia, Japan and Italy. Originally thirteen episodes, now on three videotapes, the animation covered by the series represents the peak achievements of over 7,000 artists from more than 13 countries. The films selected were awarded 8 Oscars, 21 Oscar nominations and 120 International Prizes between them. Rated: G

results.title: Masterpieces from the Louvre: bronze sculptures from France
results.creator_credit: Bob Mclean, David Burnett, Caroline Turner, Nine Network (Australia) and QAG
results.brief_description: In 1988, in conjunction with EXPO, a series of bronze sculptures and paintings, considered masterpieces of French art from the 16th-19th centuries, and which are housed at the Louvre, were exhibited at the Queensland Art Gallery. This video is a potted art history from the Renaissance to Rodin. It looks at famous patrons such as Louis XIV, the Sun King; well regarded artists and sculptors of the time; and gives a brief explanation of the key movements in Art History during that time.

results.title: Mastering Your Microwave
results.brief_description: Many new microwave owners experience great frustration when trying to learn the techniques and principles of microwave cooking. They often feel they will never master the art. The “Mastering Your Microwave” video cookbook collection has been produced by international microwave consultant, Joan McDermott, to help overcome these problems. Everyday recipes including roast meats, souffles, vegetables and fish are included on this video. Rated: G

results.title: Mastering change: managing your future in an age of uncertainty
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sealy, Matthew A Keller and CareerTrack Publications
results.brief_description: Designed to develop skills which will enable employees to cope with change and managers to introduce change with positive effects. Part 1 looks at understanding change. Part 2 presents keys to becoming change skilled, to become a victor rather than a victim of change. Part 3 gives six steps to responding to organisational change while Part 4 examines the development of future tense thinking. A handbook accompanies the series with exercises to reinforce relevant points.

results.title: Mastering change: management and leadership skills for turbulent times
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sealy, Matthew A Keller and CareerTrack Publications
results.brief_description: Designed to assist managers in the implementation of change and to ensure that employees deal with change effectively. Part 1 examines management and leadership issues and understanding the processes involved in organisational change. Part 2 looks at planning for change rather than allowing it to happen suddenly. Part 3 presents the “4 C’s” involved in managing the implementation of change. Part 4 highlights the issues involved in leading a team into the future. A handbook accompanies the series with exercises to reinforce relevant points.
